ThingDef.label: undead skeleton marrow
ThingDef.description: Bone marrow refers to the soft, spongy tissue extracted from bones. In a living organism, bone marrow produces red blood cells, platelets, and other components of blood. As such, bone marrow is essential to a living being. "Living" Skeletons, however, are not truly alive. The enchantments that grant them immortality keeps the marrow from deteriorating, unless the Skeleton is wounded. Living Skeletons "bleed" black "blood" for this reason and, if allowed to "bleed" for too long, they will expire. \n \n As Skeleton Marrow is removed from an undead being, consuming it is a rather uncomfortable experience for many. It is, nonetheless, completely safe to eat and merely tastes bland. Animals love it and it takes a very, very long time to rot.
